results.title: A Touch of the terminals
results.creator_credit: Philip Bull and Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch
results.brief_description: Its the machine age, computers are taking over - reducing the workforce and increasing productivity. The unemployed can’t afford to buy the products produced and therefore the company can’t sell its products and is losing money. To make money they cull more workers, bring in more machines and again more unemployed who can’t afford to buy. A satirical look at the effects of computers. Cast includes Martin Vaughan, Michael Ross, Ray Anderson, Tony Llewellyn-Jones.

results.title: A Toast to Melbourne
results.creator_credit: John Dixon, Kent Chadwick, Victorian Film Corporation and Cambridge Film Productions
results.brief_description: Using archival film, aerial photography, stills, prints and contemporary footage, this documentary presents the city of Melbourne and its lifestyle. Looks at the unique Victorian architecture that transformed Melbourne from a tent city during the Gold Rush to a modern and prosperous city. Captures the vibrant streetscapes, the trams, the elaborate arcades and some of the institutions that cater to Melbourne’s elite such as the Georges store and the Melbourne Club. Highlights the range of sporting activities available, showing John McEnroe, Dennis Lillee and Greg Norman among others. Visits the Separation Tree in the Botanical Gardens planted to commemorate Melbourne’s independence from NSW, the bustling Queen Victoria Market, the suburbs of St Kilda and Brighton, its beaches and the Arts Precinct. Shows crowded restaurants and pubs with rock band performances that contribute to Melbourne’s nightlife. Also includes footage of areas and buildings which have disappeared or undergone major transformations since this film was produced: the docklands; the city square; Swanston Street; Foster’s Brewery; ports. The following Australian identities are also shown: Barry Humphries, Ian ‘Molly’ Meldrum, Bob Hawke, Andrew Peacock, Phillip Adams, Dick Hamer, Joan Sutherland, Jon English, Derryn Hinch, Mike Brady, Lindsay Thompson and an assortment of VFL footballers.

results.title: A Time to kill
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, John Grisham, Hunt Lowry, Michael Nathanson, Arnon Milchan, Regency Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Talented and eager Mississippi lawyer Jake Brigance (Matthew McConaughey) is called upon to defend Carl Lee (Samuel L. Jackson) after he kills the two rednecks responsible for the brutal rape of his ten year old daughter. Carl’s act of retribution unleashes racial tensions in the small community fueled by the tactics of the Ku Klux Klan. Juggling a small, struggling law practice, his family life and attacks by the Klan, Jake reluctantly accepts legal help from law student Ellen Roark (Sandra Bullock). He also appeals to his mentor (Donald Sutherland) and friend (Oliver Platt) for support against an unscrupulous prosecutor (Kevin Spacey). Against the advice from friends, the will of his wife and the wrath of white supremacy, Jake assembles a team committed to fighting against racial intolerance forcing those around him to examine Carl’s actions and motives. Cast also includes Ashley Judd, Kiefer Sutherland, Charles L. Dutton and Brenda Fricker. Based on the novel by John Grisham. Screenplay by Akiva Goldsman. Music composed by Elliot Goldenthal.

results.title: A Time for drunken horses = Zamani baraye masti asbha [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bahman Ghobadi and Bahman Ghobadi Films
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Bahman Ghobadi “A Time for drunken horses” is an Iranian film set amid the mountainous border of Iran and Iraq. Ayoub (Ayoub Ahmadi) is a twelve-year-old Kurdish boy who is burdened with the economic responsibility of providing for his family. He has four bothers and sisters, one of whom is severely disabled. To eek out a living in the harsh landscape where his family live, Ayoub joins his uncle in a dangerous trade - taking pack mules loaded with truck tyres across the Iranian border to Iraq. The work is fraught with perils as the road is treacherous, bandits roam the terrain and rough weather impedes the journey. Once at the border Ayoub and his uncle ply their meagre goods, along with numerous others, for a pittance. Ayoub’s brother Madi is in need of a life saving operation that is prohibitively expensive for the impoverished family. Ayoub works against all the hazards to raise the necessary money. “A Time for drunken horses” has the feel and look of a documentary, one that expresses poignantly the trials of a valiant and resourceful child and his destitute people. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: A Time for Bach
results.brief_description: By pictorial means the film attempts to integrate Bach’s music and its function today into the many varied and contradictory patterns of modern life.

results.title: A taste of China: cooking with Kenneth Lo
results.creator_credit: Eddie Joffe and Thames Video Collection
results.brief_description: Kenneth Lo, world famous Chinese chef and leading authority on Chinese food, is joined by actor Vincent Price on this Chinese cookery course. Chinese cuisine is one of the oldest in the world, with many contrasts in flavour, colour and texture. Kenneth Lo unlocks the secrets and mysteries of this cuisine and provides straightforward instructions for basic methods of preparing a Chinese family meal or elaborate banquet. Chefs from Lo’s cooking school appear on this video, preparing a range of delicious recipes.

results.title: A Tale of Two Cities
results.creator_credit: Jack Conway and David O. Selznick
results.brief_description: Based on Charles Dickens great novel, “A Tale of Two Cities” is a tale of turbulent times - the French revolution, recreated in breathtaking scale and painstaking detail. And it is a timeless tale - the story of two men in love with the same woman. Ronald Colman stars in what is perceived as the best role he ever played. “A Tale of Two Cities” is a tale of romance and revolution, politics and passion, but most of all it is a true classic for all time.

results.title: A Tale of Till
results.brief_description: After briefly covering the Dark Ages and setting the scene in Germany, the film introduces Till Eulenspeigel and his place in German literature. The remainder of the film is then devoted to an outdoor puppet show of one of Till’s stories which is about the finding of purses filled with gold pieces.
